result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Joseph Kearns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard Joseph Kearns is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard Joseph Kearns was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 1.
Defendant to report to Probatiion today September 7, 2016 by 10:30 a.m.
Defendant is entitled to 1 day credit under 973.155.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apply bond on file.

Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested by Agent.

-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Domestic Abuse Assessment and comply with recommendations.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Michelle K. or Marie B.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT with Shelby K. or S.M.K.
-Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Maintain employment.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA if requested by Agent and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, Reporter: Drost, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Karl E. Anderson   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Richard Joseph Kearns appeared. Case called at 9:02 am. Atty Gherty recites agreement. Count 1 dismissed with prejudice. County #2 Guilty. Domestic Abuse Enhancer dismissed. No objection from ADA Anderson. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #2 without Domestic Abuse Enhancer. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #2 without Domestic Abuse Enhancer. Court dismisses Count #1 with prejudice. Atty's make sentencing arguments. Recess. Case recalled at 9:45 am. Court reviews file. Atty Gherty makes statement. Court orders: 1 yr probation w/h

- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearms
- No Contact with Michelle K and Marie B.
- No Abusive contact with Shelby K. and S.M.K

- Maintain Employment

- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Sign up for probation by 10:30 am on 9/7/2016
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Credit for one day against ultimate sentence  Probation review hearing scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 04:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard Joseph Kearns

Status conference on June 10, 2016 at 08:45 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Michelle K., Marie B. and S.M.K. DOB 1/17/02. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

 - It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Shelby K.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats
